answers.question: How can refugees from Ukraine get free lab tests and imaging done?
answers.answer: To get free laboratory analysis and imaging investigations, patients must have a referral ticket from a family medicine or specialist doctor with a contract with a health insurance company. They must then go to a laboratory that also has a contract with a health insurance company.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/laboratory-analysis and read the section under 'How and where to take tests for free'.
answers.read_instruction: read the section under 'How and where to take tests for free'.

answers.question: What types of medical tests are covered for free?
answers.answer: Covered laboratory analyses include hematological, serum, urine, immunological, and microbiological tests, as well as examination of sampled tissues and the Papanicolaou test. Radiology analyses, ultrasounds, doppler, and high-performance investigations like CT, MRI, scintigraphy, and angiography are also covered.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/laboratory-analysis and read the page carefully.

answers.question: How long are referrals for these tests valid?
answers.answer: The referral note for laboratory investigations is valid for 30 days. However, for all chronic diseases and analyses involving tissue collection, the validity of the referral note for investigations is up to 90 days.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/laboratory-analysis and read the page carefully.

answers.question: What should Ukrainian refugees do if a lab can't perform the tests immediately?
answers.answer: If investigations cannot be carried out right away, the laboratory must schedule the patient during the referral ticket's validity period, noting the current and next appointment dates on the ticket. If the patient refuses the appointment, the laboratory returns the referral ticket so they can go to another investigation laboratory.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/laboratory-analysis and read the section under 'Attention!'.

answers.question: When can tests be done even if a lab's funding limit has been reached?
answers.answer: Tests can be done even if a lab's contract value is exceeded for monitoring patients with COVID-19, oncological diseases, diabetes, rare diseases, cardiovascular, cerebrovascular, or neurological diseases, provided the prescribing physician specifies monitoring on the referral note. Additionally, investigations recommended during preventive consultations for patients over 40 years old are covered even if the contract value is exceeded.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/laboratory-analysis and read the page carefully.
